title: Instrumental Song for Shyvana

embed.description: An instrumental track for the League of Legends Champion Shyvana. Artwork by Ae-Rie (http://ae-rie.deviantart.com)

body:
This music is inspired by Shyvana lore. Mostly the bit before she joined Demacia as the Elite Guard. Here I wanted to make something which makes the listener be reminded of the origin of Shyv. Mostly about her being an outcast because of her mixed race and the death of her father who made her who she was. This isn't a very angry song. But I've tried to make it as intense as possible with the limiter resources I have. I really hope you like it!

The artwork is by [Ae-Rie](http://ae-rie.deviantart.com) and you can find the original art [here.](http://ae-rie.deviantart.com/art/League-of-Legends-Shyvana-398724693)

Please do leave your thoughts below and please do tell me if I can improve on things here. I will try and incorporate it in the next one! :D Happy Listening! :)

replies.body: These are amazing. You should like do these and add words (Like typing) to reflect the characters lore. Not that many people actually read the lore (especially if it's really long like some champions) So it would be really cool if you retold the most important part of a champions lore in a video with your own music to it. These are awesome and def. subscribing to your youtube (Soundcloud doesn't work for me ;  -  ;)
That's a great idea! :D I'll use that for sure! :)

I thought it was pretty cool seeing a song on here (it's more often visual art or stories), but then I saw you have a _whole playlist_ of these! Awesome!

https://soundcloud.com/bgbassphoenix/sets/league-of-legends-fan-music

What are you using to make these? If I have any feedback it's that the drums on some of them sound a bit generic or digital. Having messed around with drums in music programs myself I know that part is hard to get sounding right.

First of all, HOLY SHIT I LOVE THAT NAME! :D

These songs are made on GarageBand/Logic. Drums are digital mostly. This song has a pre recorded drum loop followed by a digitally played drum loop. I'm actually trying to find a drummer but it's hard to find any musician in India forget about a drummer. :(

Haha, thanks!

It's not a huge deal anyways, so keep it up man!
Thanks so much! I'll do my best! :)
